results.name: Shifts left under AND-convolution with itself.
comment: a(A000225(n)) mod 2 = 1, a(A062289(n)) mod 2 = 0. [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 02 2012]
reference: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
M. Bernstein and N. J. A. Sloane, Some canonical sequences of integers, Linear Alg. Applications, 226-228 (1995), 57-72; erratum 320 (2000), 210. [Link to arXiv version]

M. Bernstein and N. J. A. Sloane, Some canonical sequences of integers, Linear Alg. Applications, 226-228 (1995), 57-72; erratum 320 (2000), 210. [Link to Lin. Alg. Applic. version together with omitted figures]
mathematica: a[0]=1; a[1]=1; a[n_] := a[n] = Sum[BitAnd[a[k], a[n-k-1]], {k, 0, n-1}]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 60}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 07 2012 *)
program: x = sum $ zipWith (.&.) xs $ tail $ reverse xs :: Integer
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
